text:
What a superb Crêperie!!! This family run restaurant provides locally grown and made, fresh ingredients. 
The potage/soup is extraordinary. My wife & dah'ter had a sweet potato soup bursting with flavor. My traditional onion soup perfect. 
The various crêpes are sublime, made of buckwheat or traditional flour, portioned beyond any expectation. The cream for my dah'ter's chocolate and banana crêpe made by the farm next door. The bacon and eggs on my wife's La Bacon crêpe raised there as well. My goodness each crêpe is worth the $14-$19CDN price. Tremendous. 
Desserts and aperitifs available if you can still possibly have room. 
The service as if you are the only guest in the house. The town of Rawdon has a jewel in this restaurant.  Worth a drive to visit.

Cette crêperie vaut vraiment le détour. 
Déjà pour l'accueil, qui est vraiment chaleureux, la patronne n'hésitera pas a vous donner des conseils sur tout ce qu'il y a à faire à Rawdon et vous expliquera l'origine de produits (locaux), utilisés pour la conception des galettes, des crêpes et des alcools.
Ensuite la décoration est vraiment au top, juste ce qu'il faut, pas de surplus, en belle harmonie.
Parlons de la bouffe, des galettes au sarrasin, juste cuites comme il faut, bien moelleuses, et croustillantes autours. Pour les crêpes, je conseillerai celle au chocolat à 70% de cacao ou celle au caramel au beurre salé (on peut sentir des petits grains de sel, extra).

A noter, le concept de la crêperie, c'est d'être ouverte toute la journée (du jeudi au dimanche de 11h à 21h).

Pour deux, une galette et une crêpe chacun, une bouteille d'hydromel (750 ml) façon champenoise (soupe comprises avec les galettes) et deux cafés, comptez 100$ (Avant taxes et tips), cela peut sembler cher, mais il s'agit néanmoins d'UN TRÈS BON rapport qualité/prix !!!

One word : Amazing!

This Creperie is family owned and provides its patrons with organic ingredients made by locally owned businesses. Sounds great right? Well it certainly tastes great too! 

I went with their sweet crepe with melted salted caramel and apples. It was mind blowingly gooooood! It even came with the freshest small garden salad that was actually surprisingly good as well! Probably the best crepe I've ever eaten in my life.

Our hostess was french (france) and delighted us with her service, telling us when prompted what her place was all about in a setting that truly felt out that we were transported elsewhere with a charming interior with a quaint rustic feel to the creperie.

The price-tag was about average and the saddest part of this review is this place is located in Rawdon, what I'd give to have something like this closer to Montreal.

Will be back for sure, whenever I find myself back in Rawdon.
